a.title: Slice numberOfSubunits: The number of linear sequences of nucleotides linked through phosphodiester bonds shall be described. Subunits would be strands of nucleic acids that are tightly associated typically through Watson-Crick base pairing. NOTE: If not specified in the reference source, the assumption is that there is 1 subunit.

a.title: Slice fivePrime: The nucleotide present at the 5’ terminal shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. a.title: Slice connectivity: The entity that links the sugar residues together should also be captured for nearly all naturally occurring nucleic acid the linkage is a phosphate group. For many synthetic oligonucleotides phosphorothioate linkages are often seen. Linkage connectivity is assumed to be 3’-5’. If the linkage is either 3’-3’ or 5’-5’ this should be specified.

a.title: Legend for this format

title.value: Cross-version Extension `R5.SubstanceNucleicAcid` for use in FHIR R4

description.value: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `SubstanceNucleicAcid` for use in FHIR R4.

purpose.value:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the element `SubstanceNucleicAcid` as defined in FHIR R5 in FHIR R4.
The source element is defined as: `SubstanceNucleicAcid` 0..* `SubstanceNucleicAcid`
Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as: * R5 `SubstanceNucleicAcid` 0..* `SubstanceNucleicAcid`
Following are the generation technical comments: Element `SubstanceNucleicAcid` is not mapped to FHIR R4, since FHIR R5 `SubstanceNucleicAcid` is not mapped.

short.value: Nucleic acids are defined by three distinct elements: the base, sugar and linkage. Individual substance/moiety IDs will be created for each of these elements. The nucleotide sequence will be always entered in the 5’-3’ direction

definition.value: Nucleic acids are defined by three distinct elements: the base, sugar and linkage. Individual substance/moiety IDs will be created for each of these elements. The nucleotide sequence will be always entered in the 5’-3’ direction.
